current_task.title: Fix Matrix Room Joining - Add Room Alias on Creation
current_task.description:
Users cannot join already-created rooms. The Matrix join call fails with 404 because no room alias exists.

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
In Home.jsx, when creating a Matrix room (lines 285-297), the code uses `client.createRoom()` but does NOT set a `room_alias_name`. This means:
1. Creator creates room → gets internal room_id like `!abc123:localhost` (no alias)
2. Joiner tries to join via `#roomName:localhost` (alias) → 404 because alias doesn't exist

The 409 error from `/api/rooms/create` is expected behavior - the backend roomManager correctly rejects duplicate room names. The actual bug is the missing Matrix room alias.

FIX:
Add `room_alias_name: roomName` to the createRoom options in Home.jsx. This creates a room alias that joiners can use.

IMPORTANT: The `room_alias_name` should be the local part only (e.g., 'duck'), NOT the full alias (e.g., '#duck:localhost'). The Matrix server appends the server name automatically.
acceptance_criteria: Home.jsx createRoom() call includes room_alias_name: roomName in options object
When creating room 'duck', Matrix room is created with alias '#duck:localhost'
When joining room 'duck', Matrix client can resolve '#duck:localhost' and join successfully
Both creator and joiner enter the same Matrix room (same room_id)
